intro: Solidago rugosa var. cronquistiana, commonly known as the Cronquist's rough goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are rough and hairy, and the flowers are yellow, forming dense clusters at the ends of the stems. It is a perennial herb that plays an important role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
